examples.text: Lots of children play cops and robbers.
Penn stars as a rookie cop out to prove himself.
The film is based on the true story of a New York cop.
The star was stopped by traffic cops on Friday night.

definitions.definition: used by somebody who is caught doing something wrong, to say that they admit that they are wrong

examples.text: He's not much cop as a singer.

wordOrigin: early 18th cent. (as a verb): perhaps from obsolete cap ‘arrest’, from Old French caper ‘seize’, from Latin capere. The noun is from copper ‘police officer’.
